clinical_study.brief_title: Total Knee Arthroplasty: Comparison of Fixed and Mobile Bearings
clinical_study.official_title: Total Knee Arthroplasty: Comparison of Fixed and Mobile Bearings

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to provide gait parameters as a new objective method to assess total knee arthroplasty outcome between patients with fixed- and mobile-bearing, using an ambulatory device with minimal sensor configuration.

primary_outcome.description: distance in meters of gait stride lenght measured by a data logger with five inertial sensors

The EQ-5D is a measure of self-reported health outcomes that is applicable to a wide range of health conditions and treatments. It consists of two parts: a descriptive system (Part I) and a visual analogue scale (VAS) (Part II). Part I of the scale consists of 5 single-item dimensions including: mobility, self care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has a 3 point response scale designed to indicate the level of the problem. Part II uses a vertical graduated VAS (thermometer) to measure health status, ranging from worst imaginable health state to best imaginable health state. T. Descriptive data from the 5 dimensions of Part I can be used to generate a health-related quality of life profile for the subject. Part II is scored from 0 (worst health state imaginable) to 100 (best health state imaginable). The score from Part II can be used to track changes in health, on an individual or group level, over time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Semi-objective Evaluation Knee Sciety Score (KSS) Clinical Outcome Measures
secondary_outcome.description: Scoring system to clinically rate the knee abefore and after TK, scored from 0 to 100 with lower scores being indicative of worse knee conditions and higher scores being indicative of better knee conditions.
count of numbers of dislocated implants.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients suffering from a primary unilateral knee osteoarthritis and requiring a knee replacement
- Informed consent

group.title: TKA Mobile
group.description: TKA mobile Total knee arthroplasty with mobile bearing implant.

group.description: Total knee arthroplasty with fixed bearing implant.

outcome.title: Gait Stride Length
outcome.description: distance in meters of gait stride lenght measured by a data logger with five inertial sensors

group.title: Preoperative
group.description: preoperative stride lenght of all participants

group.title: 5 Years
group.description: stride lenght at 1 year following TKA of all participants

measure.title: Gait Stride Length
measure.description: distance in meters of gait stride lenght measured by a data logger with five inertial sensors

analysis.groups_desc: FB group was designated the control group. We determined a sample size based in clinical criteria. Using an α of 0.05 and β of 0.8, the required sample size was calculated to be 24 patients in each group to achieve a power of 80%. Descriptive analysis was completed on demographic information and clinical and radiological outcomes. Nonparametric tests (Wilcoxon’s signed ranks or rank sum tests) were used for comparison of scores. The chi-squared test was used for dichotomous variables.

outcome.title: EuroQoL Quality of Life Scale (EQ-5D)
outcome.description: The EQ-5D is a measure of self-reported health outcomes that is applicable to a wide range of health conditions and treatments. It consists of two parts: a descriptive system (Part I) and a visual analogue scale (VAS) (Part II). Part I of the scale consists of 5 single-item dimensions including: mobility, self care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has a 3 point response scale designed to indicate the level of the problem. Part II uses a vertical graduated VAS (thermometer) to measure health status, ranging from worst imaginable health state to best imaginable health state. T. Descriptive data from the 5 dimensions of Part I can be used to generate a health-related quality of life profile for the subject. Part II is scored from 0 (worst health state imaginable) to 100 (best health state imaginable). The score from Part II can be used to track changes in health, on an individual or group level, over time.
outcome.population: data collected in 25 patients on each group (as this a patient reported outcome, thr data was missing in some of the cases)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
